meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside had left her shaken.
meanings.sent2: She was shaken by the unexpected news.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked shaken after the vacuum cleaner turned on.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was shaken by the criticism.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake had left the town shaken and fearful.

meanings.definition: To mix or agitate by shaking
meanings.sent1: She shaken the salad dressing vigorously.
meanings.sent2: The bartender shaken the cocktail before serving.
meanings.sent3: The kids had fun shaken the snow globe.
meanings.sent4: The painter shaken the paint cans to mix the colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef shaken the ingredients in the pan to create a delicious dish.

meanings.sent1: The tiny bird shaken with cold in the winter breeze.
meanings.sent2: His voice shaken as he spoke in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The old bridge shaken in the strong wind.
meanings.sent4: The leaves on the tree shaken in the autumn wind.
meanings.sent5: Her hands shaken with nerves before the big presentation.

meanings.definition: To be moved or affected emotionally
meanings.sent1: The movie's ending had everyone shaken.
meanings.sent2: She was shaken by the heartfelt letter from her friend.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's adorable antics always leave me shaken.
meanings.sent4: The touching song lyrics had the audience shaken.
meanings.sent5: His speech at the event left the audience shaken with inspiration.
